channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.
channel.prism:copyright: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Fatigue-free ferroelectricity in Hf<sub>0.5</sub>Zr<sub>0.5</sub>O<sub>2</sub> ultrathin films via interfacial design
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 15 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63048-3

HfO2-based ferroelectrics offer new options for memory but face reliability issues. By exploring device fatigue mechanisms, the authors develop an interface design strategy that regulates defect movement in films, improving its overall reliability performance.
item.dc:title: Fatigue-free ferroelectricity in Hf<sub>0.5</sub>Zr<sub>0.5</sub>O<sub>2</sub> ultrathin films via interfacial design
item.dc:creator: Chao Zhou
Yanpeng Feng

Haoliang Huang

item.title: Long spin lifetimes of charge carriers in rubrene crystals due to fast transient-localization motion
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 15 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62830-7

Spin relaxation in organic semiconductors is normally strongly correlated with temperature, varying over many orders of magnitude from 4 K to 300 K. Here, the authors report stable, microsecond-long spin lifetimes in rubrene single crystals due to the rapid transient localization of charge carriers.
item.dc:title: Long spin lifetimes of charge carriers in rubrene crystals due to fast transient-localization motion
item.dc:creator: Remington L. Carey
Xinglong Ren
Ian E. Jacobs
Jan Elsner
Sam Schott
Elliot Goldberg
Zichen Wang
Jochen Blumberger
Henning Sirringhaus

item.title: Flexible Ag<sub>2</sub>Se-based thin-film thermoelectrics for sustainable energy harvesting and cooling
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 15 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62336-2

Here the authors report a low-cost method to fabricate flexible Ag2Se thermoelectric films with high performance and durability, enabling efficient energy harvesting and cooling in wearable and portable thermoelectric devices.
item.dc:title: Flexible Ag<sub>2</sub>Se-based thin-film thermoelectrics for sustainable energy harvesting and cooling
item.dc:creator: Wenyi Chen
Meng Li
Xiaodong Wang
